snippet: Jonathan Rowley of UBS notes in an opinion article in The Financial Times that businesses are still being auctioned. But, he writes, “the timetable and due diligence process – both of which were carefully controlled by the seller in an auction...
abstract: Jonathan Rowley of UBS notes in an opinion article in The Financial Times that businesses are still being auctioned. But, he writes, “the timetable and due diligence process – both of which were carefully controlled by the seller in an auction environment, have become more determined by the buyer.”
lead_paragraph: Jonathan Rowley of UBS notes in an opinion article in The Financial Times that businesses are still being auctioned. But, he writes, “the timetable and due diligence process – both of which were carefully controlled by the seller in an auction environment, have become more determined by the buyer. This has meant deeper scrutiny and due diligence towards selling companies than I can remember in a long time.” Read more »
